text: To reset your account password, go to the login page and click 'Forgot password'. Follow the instructions in the email you receive.
You can update your billing information from the 'Billing' section in your account settings. Add new payment methods or update existing ones.
Our service supports major credit cards and digital wallets. Transactions usually process instantly but sometimes take a few minutes.
You can contact support using the in-app chat or by emailing support@example.com. Response time is typically one business day.
If you see an unfamiliar charge, check if a family member used your card. If not, contact support to investigate potential fraud.
Enable two-factor authentication from the Security section to increase account protection.
Cardholders can manage their saved cards under 'Payment Methods'. You can remove expired cards here.
For subscription services, charges may appear as recurring transactions. You can cancel subscriptions from your settings page.
Refunds usually take 5â€“7 business days to appear in your account depending on your bank.
To update personal profile details, navigate to the 'Profile' tab and edit your information.
Some merchants require additional verification for high-value transactions. You may receive a verification code.
If your card is declined, verify your available balance and card expiration date.
Digital wallet payments may require biometric authentication such as FaceID or fingerprint.
Recurring payments can be paused or canceled in the 'Subscriptions' tab under account settings.
You can download receipts for all previous transactions under the 'History' section.
If a payment is pending, it may take up to 24 hours to clear depending on the merchant.
To prevent unauthorized access, avoid sharing your login credentials with anyone.
For travel abroad, notify your bank in advance to avoid unexpected card declines.
If your card is lost or stolen, immediately freeze it in the 'Security' section.
Cardholders can export their full transaction history as CSV from the 'Reports' tab.
If your email is not receiving verification codes, check your spam folder and whitelist our domain.
Temporary authorizations may appear as pending charges and disappear within a few days.
Once a refund is issued by the merchant, we immediately forward it to your bank for processing.
If your app is not loading, try clearing cache or reinstalling the application.
Some merchants may charge a small verification amount, which will be refunded automatically.
To onboard as a merchant, provide your business name, legal entity type, tax ID, and a payout bank account. Applications are reviewed within two business days.
Payouts are sent to the bank account configured in the 'Payouts' section. Settlement times depend on your region and risk profile.
Merchants can view detailed transaction reports under 'Reports'. Filters include date, currency, and payment method.
Chargebacks can be managed from the 'Disputes' page. Merchants may upload receipts, delivery confirmations, or refund proof.
To reduce fraud, merchants can enable velocity rules, country restrictions, and 3D Secure enforcement.
The payment API requires amount, currency, and a unique order ID for each transaction request.
Test credentials for the sandbox environment are available in the 'Developers' section.
High-risk merchants may receive delayed payouts until identity verification is completed.
Merchants can instantly refund customers from the 'Transactions' tab by selecting 'Issue Refund'.
If settlement fails, check your payout bank account details for accuracy.
Batch payouts allow merchants to group many smaller transactions into a single daily transfer.
Webhook notifications can be enabled to receive updates on transaction status changes.
Dispute response deadlines vary by card network but typically range from 7 to 21 days.
Merchants can download monthly statements in PDF format from the dashboard.
3D Secure authentication reduces fraud risk by shifting liability to the card issuer.
API rate limits depend on plan tier. Exceeding your quota results in temporary throttling.
To comply with AML regulations, merchants may be required to submit business verification documents.
Settlement currency can be configured in the 'Payout Settings' page.
Anomalous transaction patterns may temporarily trigger risk reviews.
Failed webhook deliveries will be retried multiple times with exponential backoff.
Merchants can reconcile transactions by exporting detailed CSV reports.
Full refunds return the entire transaction amount, while partial refunds must specify an amount.
If a customer claims fraud, merchants should provide proof of delivery and communication logs.
API errors include descriptive codes. Refer to the 'Error Reference' section for troubleshooting guidance.
Merchants can configure custom risk rules such as IP filtering, velocity checks, and device fingerprinting.
